statements: SELECT * FROM users;
SELECT user_id, username FROM users WHERE role = 'admin';
SELECT username, email FROM users ORDER BY email DESC;
SELECT user_id, role FROM users WHERE username LIKE 'J%';
SELECT DISTINCT role FROM users ORDER BY role ASC;
SELECT * FROM users WHERE role = 'admin' ORDER BY username DESC;
SELECT user_id, username, email FROM users WHERE email LIKE '%@gmail.com';
SELECT * FROM users WHERE role = 'user' AND username LIKE 'A%' ORDER BY email ASC;
SELECT username, role FROM users WHERE email LIKE '%@yahoo.com' LIMIT 10 OFFSET 5;
SELECT user_id, email, role FROM users WHERE role='admin' AND email NOT LIKE '%@yahoo.com' AND username LIKE '%m%' ORDER BY user_id DESC;

SELECT user_id, username, email FROM users ORDER BY username DESC;
SELECT u.username, ur.role_name FROM users u JOIN user_roles ur ON u.user_id = ur.role_id;

SELECT u.username, r.role_name FROM users u JOIN user_roles ur ON u.user_id = ur.user_id JOIN roles r ON ur.role_id = r.role_id WHERE r.role_name = 'Admin';

SELECT p.project_name, COUNT(up.user_id) AS user_count FROM projects p LEFT JOIN user_projects up ON p.project_id = up.project_id GROUP BY p.project_name;
SELECT * FROM users u WHERE u.user_id NOT IN (SELECT user_id FROM user_projects);
